Title: Southwest Residential Children's Homes 2016 - 2020
Description:
Bath and North East Somerset Council ("the Council") acting as the Lead Authority on behalf of participating Local Authorities of Bristol City Council, South Gloucestershire Council, Gloucestershire County Council, North Somerset Council, Dorset County Council, Swindon Borough Council, Wiltshire Council and Bath & North East Somerset Council (the Local Authorities), are seeking tenders to meet the following categories of need: 
·         Category A: Residential Children's Homes 
·         Category B: Children's Homes with for children and young people with a disability (to include learning, physical and sensor impairments)
 
 
 
Suppliers interested in this opportunity should express their interest by clicking on the 'login and register interest' button below.
 
New users to the system must register first to obtain a user name and password before returning to this opportunity.  Please refer to the suppliers guide 'Visiting Site for the First Time' by clicking the 'Help' button.
 
Once suppliers have expressed their interest they can access the procurement documentation from 'My Opportunities' on the home page. 
 
Upon registering interest and commencing the tendering process tenderers must not approach any member of the Authority directly or indirectly in relation to the tender.  If clarification is required regarding this tender, all questions must be submitted via "discussions" on the "Supplying the South West" portal from where the tender documents were downloaded.

Title: CP1555-18 Peninsula Residential Children's Homes
Description:
The Peninsula Children's Services Partnership is a long-standing collaboration between:
- Somerset County Council,
- Devon County Council,
- Torbay Council, 
- Plymouth City Council

The Partnership aims to secure excellent and innovative services for children, young people, and families through sub-regional collaboration.
The work of the Partnership includes joint-commissioning of placements for children and young people in care.
A key activity for 2018 is the re-commissioning of the contract for residential children's homes.  The Peninsula Authorities require a range of placements to meet the needs of children and young people in care. The aim is to achieve a multi-provider framework of Ofsted regulated homes.

Title: East Midlands Regional Children's Framework Agreement
Description:
Northamptonshire County Council, on behalf of the East Midlands Regional Children's Framework Agreement (EMRCF) Consortium, wishes to invite Tenders for the provision of Children's Homes and Fostering Services Placements for Children and Young People. 

 The EMRCF Consortium includes the following local authorities: 
 o Derby City Council 
 o Derbyshire County Council 
 o Leicestershire County Council 
 o Northamptonshire County Council 
 o Nottingham City Council 
 o Nottinghamshire County Council 
 o Rutland County Council 

 The Services for the EMRCF Framework Agreement to be provided have been categorised into two (2) Lots and split into Categories, which are described in terms of complexity and risk for each Child or Young Person's individual needs. 
 The Lots are split as follows: 
 Lot 1: Children's Homes 
 o Category 1.1 Standard Children's Homes Emotional Behaviour Difficulties (EBD) Provision 
 o Category 1.2 Specialist Children's Homes Emotional Behaviour Difficulties (EBD) Provision 
 o Category 1.3 Specialist Children's Homes Autistic Spectrum Condition (ASC) with challenging behaviour - non Learning Difficulties (LD) or low level LD 
 o Category 1.4 Specialist Children's Homes Autistic Spectrum Condition (ASC) with challenging behaviour - moderate or severe LD 
 o Category 1.5 Specialist Children's Homes Complex Health Needs 
 Lot 2: Fostering Services 
 o Category 2.1 Standard Fostering Provision 
 o Category 2.2 Specialist Fostering Provision 
 o Category 2.3 Specialist Fostering Disabilities 
 o Category 2.4 Specialist Fostering Complex Health Needs 

 Potential Providers can supply Services for one or more Lots and Categories and will be expected to set out in their Tenders how they will deliver the Services they apply for, with reference to the Specification. 

 The light touch regime (LTR) applies to the services under the EMRCF framework agreement as per Public Contracts Regulations 2015, This EMRCF Framework Agreement was originally set up in February 2016 for four (4) years and is being re-opened on an annual basis to allow new Providers to be added to the Framework Agreement or existing Providers to apply for additional Lots, Categories or Provisions. 

 Full details of how to complete and submit an ITT are available on the Northampton County Council's LGSS eSourcing system (Due North).

 URL: https://www.lgssprocurementportal.co.uk/
 Contract Reference number: DN119587
 If assistance is required regarding the use of the LGSS e-Tendering portal, please contact the due north help desk on:
 T: +44 330 005 0352 
 E: ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com
 The Tender closes at 12Noon on 21st September, 2017.

Title: C0231 - Foster Care Framework - AWARD
Description:
Birmingham City Council invites you to tender for a framework contract for the provision of foster care services by independent fostering agencies.
This will be on a framework contract with Birmingham City Council, with the ability for the following local Authorities to be able to call off from the framework:  Coventry City Council, Dudley Metropolitan Borough Council, Herefordshire Council, Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council, Shropshire Council, Solihull Metropolitan Borough Council, Staffordshire County Council, Stoke-On-Trent City Council, Borough of Telford and Wrekin , Walsall Council, Warwickshire County Council, Wolverhampton City Council and Worcestershire County Council. 
The framework will commence on 4th April 2016 for a period of two years with an option to extend further for up to two years.

Based on current data sourced from the above named local authorities, it is anticipated that the activity under this proposed framework will be:
•	Around 1700 new placements each year
•	Circa £110 million pound spend each year
